battery-life_ipod_nano_8gb: i bought the nano as a replacement for an older classic, which was a great unit but time has taken it's toll on the battery and screen .
battery life isn't great, but other than that, would highly recommend .
i think apple's idea is that instead of replacing the battery, you will exchange it for a newer ipod .
make it inconvenient to replace the battery make it convenient to replace the ipod .
the pedometer feature seems accurate, but a battery waster .
short battery life i like the product .
good quality scratch resistant light portable long battery
gas_mileage_toyota_camry_2007: doesn't anyone build a quiet car out there for around 30k that used regular gas and gets good gas mileage ?
mileage out of the showroom was way below advertised , but seems to have come around over time .

hesitating then surge between shifts, windshield wipers that move with power that rocks the car to the point that it feels like it will roll over, plastic parts falling off, cruise control is so unreliable i don't use it, bad mileage, and, last but not least, half the windshild blacks out when driving at night through areas without street lights .
it gets great mileage for a v6, good sound system that comes standard in all camrys and overall styling looks sporty and aggressive .
gas mileage at 7500 mi is still around 20 mpg and i'm hoping it will improve as i rack up the mileage .
this new one gets even better mileage, averages about 33 freeway .
i've had this car for a year , bought it for the low emissions, safety, and good mileage rating , and i'm considering trading it in .
room_holiday_inn_london: be cautious of using the room services like the phone, mini bar and room service as the prices are sky high, but i would definitely stay there again and i would recommend this hotel to anyone !
the bathroom was small, and water pressure was weak, but it was doable .
i politely explained about my shock at being given a completely different room than what was booked !
upon arrival to the room itself, we discover that we have in fact been given a disabled, non smoking room .

the next day, after coming back from sighseeing at around midnight, we went up to the room after seeing the queue of 8 persons waiting to see the receptionist and amazingly our keys worked and our bags were where we have left them .
overall i couldn't have been more satisfied and far from assigning me a humble room because i'd booked a discounted hotwire rate, i was given a room upgrade !
the room was a decent size for a london hotel room .
location_holiday_inn_london: great room fabulous price wonderful location !
like other reviews, the location of the hotel is great, seconds around the corner from the tube .
the holiday inn kensington forum has a fantastic location for a city break in london .
the best thing was the location .
good price location but no thrills .
the location is great , very close to gloucester road tube, with waitrose supermarket, coffee shops and restaurants nearby .
staff_bestwestern_hotel_sfo: all the staff we encountered were super friendly and the hotel location is great .
on the plus side some of the staff were nice and helpful especially the concierge who was most gracious .
no mention of the lies, arrogance and up you attitude of some of the staff then ?
right from checking in, the staff was unbelievable !
every single staff member we came into contact with was extremely helpful and very nice !
voice_garmin_nuvi_255W_gps: the voice is very clear and gives plenty of warning when we need to make a turn ahead .
the default voice is extremely clear and easy to understand, so i never even tried any of the alternative voices .
many a times, this is a distraction as you will be wondering what the voice command said .

other than the magellan's screen being an inch smaller , but really noticeable , the magellan did not have text to voice, and often would take a much longer route even though we told it to take freeways .
the most noticeable thing is that the screen is much easier to read, and that the text to voice is extremely valuable and much better than a beep just as you need to turn .
and the voice and streets match perfectly .
the female voice is much clearer than jack, the male american english .
speed_garmin_nuvi_255W_gps: speed of calculation, accuracy, and simplicity of operation are top notch .
when you are looking at the map, you are shown the speed limit for the road you are travelling on, and your actual speed .
indicates posted speed limits of the road you are on
on the lower left hand side, this unit shows the maximum speed limit for the road you are traveling .
this is very useful feature because many a times this will help to avoid the risk of getting a speeding ticket .
by the way, the bottom menu also shows your current driving speed .
that's what the car's speedometer is for .
size_asus_netbook_1005ha: , i was willing to downsize my screen size in favor of portability and speed .
speaking of which, the keyboard's relatively large size , at 92% of the size of a normal one , writing longer texts on it is no problem .
the keyboard isn't quite full sized of course, but very easy to get used to .

i had some real problems trying to use my toshiba satellite when flying for the past few years, and the distance between the top of the display and the edge of the netbook when open is a practical size to get my work done on a flight .
the keyboard, more than 90% standard size, is just large enough .
, don't know why they use the screen size most do , 1024 x 600 seems cramped
everything i needed in a laptop without the heavy, bulky size .
screen_garmin_nuvi_255W_gps: the garmin nuvi 255w i bought through amazon has a dead red pixel which is always on and what is worse is that the position of that red dot is right in the middle of the screen .
i've only used the wide screen versions, so i can't compare, but i personally wouldn't want to go to a smaller screen .
if you missed the spoken directions, you can look at the top of the screen for written directions .
so, although the nuvi doesn't verbalize those directions, i can look at the screen to see the exit i need to take .
the screen is bright and the maps are generally good .
there were a few times i drove under overpasses on the interstate and no intersection was shown on the screen .
battery-life_amazon_kindle: by the way, kindle battery lasts forever indeed !
a week ago, i ordered my kindle 2 and when it was delivered, the battery was in critical stage and it would not power on .
battery life is very good, even with the wireless on constantly .
k2 goes into sleep mode if you leave it be for a few minutes, but in this mode it still uses battery power if wireless is enabled .
many have been critical of the non user replaceability of the battery .
i can do without the k2 several years from now for a week while the battery gets replaced .
more likely, by the time the battery no longer holds a charge, there will be a k7 with a color screen and 200 times the memory that i'll want to upgrade to !
satellite_garmin_nuvi_255W_gps: it grabs satellites quickly and recalculates routes in seconds after i veer off in the wrong direction .

by the time the main menu comes up after turning the device on it generally already has a full 100% signal from the satellites and it's ready to navigate, a beautiful crystal clear lcd widescreen, and tons of other features .
the time that it takes to acqure the satellites is about 10, 30 seconds .
after turning the unit off and back on again, the gps unit must search for satellites and re, locate me .
when i first turned the unit on, it had to search for satellites and pinpoint my location .
i tested it again on a road trip and constantly lost satellite reception .

keyboard_netbook_1005ha: a lot of netbooks on the market have mangled the keyboard in one way or another such that if you are a touch typist, you find yourself hitting the wrong key often, which is frustrating .
the keyboard is easy to type on , the battery life is great, and i've found that i really do like the touch pad with all its features .
the keyboard is generous for a netbook, but i still have some trouble typing on it .
they keyboard takes some getting used to, but even still, i could not write a novel on this .
keyboard feels funny at first, but you get used to it .
the keyboard isn't quite full sized of course, but very easy to get used to .

performance_netbook_1005ha: very acceptable performance for what netbooks are designed to do .

it enhances performance, but is not absolutely necessary because this unit is a full featured machine .
otherwise its performance has been bug, free and met all expectations .
replacing them isn't very hard given a screw and five minutes, and doing so noticeably ups the performance .
i haven't hit my swap yet in several weeks of heavy use, and performance has been more than satisfactory for what i do with it .

the significant transmission hesitations are unacceptable and possibly unsafe, and the 4 cyl engine provides inadequate power when challenged .

allows you to type in two street names, and if they intersect, the gps unit will give you directions to that intersection .
